title: Cleveland boy shot outside restaurant on city's East Side
content:
(File photo)
CLEVELAND, Ohio -- A 17-year-old boy was shot in the leg early Wednesday on his way to a restaurant in Cleveland's Mt. Pleasant neighborhood.
The shooting happened about 1 a.m. near Whitmore's Bar-B-Q at Kinsman Road and East 153rd Street, according to a Cleveland police report.
The boy said he parked in a lot and was on his way to buy food from the restaurant when a male approached him, police say.
The male told the 17-year-old "You told on my boy, you better run," the report says. The boy sprinted toward his car and the male fired off a round, but missed, police say.
The boy hid behind his car and the gunman hopped into a minivan carrying four or five more men, which turned onto Kinsman Road, the report says.
The gunman fired off several more rounds, as the van continued down the street. One of the bullets struck the boy in his lower leg, the report says.
Paramedics treated the boy at the scene and took him to University Hospitals, where he was treated and released.
He told police he recognized the gunman from a November incident on East 128th Street, the report says.
Detectives continue investigating.
